record.dc:title: 112BY13 Ledford Island, Bradley County, Tennessee. Burial 16BY1, an indeterminate infant with mass of pulverized mussel shell (F.S. 154) and sandy clay over pelvis and antler tip (F.S. 155). Square 0R17. Direction East.
record.wpa:narrative: Indeterminate infant in fair condition, partly flexed on right side with head to south. Apparently the knees were originally flexed upward--they were about 0.1' above the pelvis. The pit was filled with mottled humic and yellow silt and sand. F.S. 154 had a molded conformation as though once contained in some sort of bag.
